decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - INFORMATIVE:  You are advised that the size of the proposed roof extensions is very close to the maximum allowed as 'permitted development'. You should therefore ensure that the extensions are built no larger than shown on the approved drawings. You are further advised that this certificate is issued on the understanding that the party walls of the house are not to be raised. If the party walls were to be built up, planning permission would be required.
description: APPLICATION FOR A CERTIFICATE OF LAWFULNESS FOR A PROPOSED ROOF EXTENSION TO THE REAR OF THE MAIN PART OF THE HOUSE AND ABOVE PART OF THE BACK ADDITION.
